data.description:
See the highlights of Oslo in one afternoon on a leisurely paced, 3-hour bike tour. Suitable for all fitness levels, your tour takes in top Oslo sights, like Frognerparken (Vigeland Park), Aker Brygge shipyard, the Royal Palace, City Hall and Akershus Castle. Following an expert guide, you’ll discover all the insider information about this gorgeous Scandinavian city while exploring its best sites.

This small-group Oslo bike tour is limited to 15 people, ensuring you'll receive personal attention from your guide.

From 01 November 2023 – 29 February 2024 we alter the tour to accommodate winter conditions. We equip our bikes with spiked tires so that we can explore Oslo’s sights safely. Sites visited can change based on weather and seasonal activities such as Christmas markets, and are chosen by our guides based on being safely accessible. Please note that this winter tour is recommended only for individuals with cycling experience and is only available to those over the age of 12.
data.name: Oslo Highlights Bike Tour

reviews.content: Fuimos dos adultos con tres niños y el paseo en bici es apto para todos. Oslo es una ciudad magnífica para recorrerla en bici. Tranquila y con pocos coches. La guía muy simpática. Nos encantó!!

Assolutamente da consigliare . La guida Alicia ci ha portato in zone della città che da soli non avremmo mai visitato. Spiegazioni dettagliate e interessanti dei luoghi e dei monumenti . Il massimo dei voti per questa esperienza 👍🏻
A faire dès votre arrivée en ville !! Notre guide Shaf a rendu cette visite très intéressante , sympathique avec un anglais facile à comprendre.

data.description:
Go for a gander on a tour which reflects the energy and welcoming nature of Glasgow itself. All tours are conducted by myself, Johnny -- so if you have read a good review, you will know that that is the tour that you will be getting! I will provide you with a memorable introduction to this stupendous city, and at the conclusion of the tour, will be delighted to email you as many Glasgow recommendations as you can handle, tailored to your personal interests.

Walk with the self-styled Glasgow Gander around Glasgow City Centre, from Royal Exchange Square to Glasgow Cathedral, taking in the city's famed Victorian architecture, and drinking deeply of its vibrant atmosphere. Learn the fascinating story of Glasgow in the company of a passionate guide.
data.name: Gander Walking Tours in Glasgow

reviews.content: John was very informative throughout the tour. He kept the kids entertained as well while we walked along. We learned so many interesting things about Glascow. We would definitely recommend this tour to others!

messages.content:
Here are the three lowest-priced, bookable sightseeing deals we could find for Beijing during the National-Day “Golden Week” (prices shown for 1 adult in US $).  All of them still have thousands of tickets left for Thursday 3 October 2024.

1)  Beijing Summer Palace Entrance Ticket (no guide)
   • Price: 7.88 USD  
   • What it covers: main gate entry to the Summer Palace; explore on your own.  
   • 3 Oct availability: MANY slots open from 07:00 to 14:00 (earliest and cheapest option above).  Every slot shows 10 000 + tickets, so you can book at any time that suits you.

2)  Beijing Temple of Heaven Entrance Ticket (no guide)
   • Price: 7.88 USD  
   • What it covers: park entry + two temple halls; self-guided.  
   • 3 Oct availability: Slots at 08:00, 10:00, 13:30 and 15:00, all with 10 000 tickets or more.  Cheapest adult ticket is the same 7.88 USD; child tickets are about 6.80 USD and infants are free.

3)  Summer Palace Admission Ticket – Pre-booking Service
   • Price: 8.90 USD  
   • What it covers: QR-code ticket that lets you scan straight in any time 06:00-18:30 (peak-season admission).  
   • 3 Oct availability: “Full-day” slot (you choose when to go) shows 10 000 + tickets left.  Senior (60 +) and child tickets are even cheaper (from 7.90 USD and 4.90 USD).

Budget tips for National-Day week
• Book NOW – although the system shows huge ticket stock today, quotas can vanish quickly once domestic sales open.  
• Go early (before 08:30) or late afternoon to avoid the heaviest crowds and security queues.  
• Use Metro rather than taxis:  
   – Summer Palace: Line 4 “Beigongmen” Exit D (walk 300 m).  
   – Temple of Heaven: Line 5 “Tiantandongmen” Exit A.  
• Bring passport or Mainland ID: you’ll need the same ID number you enter online to collect/scan your ticket at the gate.  
• Pack light—bags are X-rayed at every major site, which adds waiting time during Golden Week.

Enjoy your wallet-friendly Beijing adventure!

messages.content:
Here are the three lowest-priced sightseeing activities currently listed for Suzhou over the Christmas period, together with their ticket status for 25 December 2024.

1. Suzhou City Walk  
   • From US $75 per adult (single-price tour, 8 h, English guide, free cancellation)  
   • 25 Dec slots: 09:00 (and later variants) – more than 9 000 tickets still open → AVAILABLE

2. Private Round-Trip Transfer to Tianping Mountain from Suzhou  
   • Base price shown online: US $100.51 for one traveller  
     – Tiered prices drop to ≈ US $50.70 pp for 2, US $34.10 pp for 3, US $25.60 pp for 4 and ≈ US $24.40 pp for 6 (cheapest possible).  
   • 25 Dec slots: 08:00 / 08:30 / 09:00 / 09:30 / 10:00 – thousands of tickets left → AVAILABLE

3. Private Round-Trip Transfer to Tianping Mountain & Mudu Water Town  
   • Same base price structure as #2 (US $100.51 for one; down to ≈ US $24.40 pp for a 6-person group).  
   • 25 Dec slots: 08:00 / 09:00 / 10:00 / 11:00 / 12:00 – thousands of tickets left → AVAILABLE

Budget notes
• Travelling solo: Suzhou City Walk (US $75) is the clear budget pick.  
• Travelling as a pair or small group: once you split the tiered pricing, the private transfers can work out cheaper per person (≤ US $50.70 for 2; ≤ US $34.10 for 3; ≈ US $25 pp for 4+).  
• All three products support free cancellation and still show very large ticket allocations, so booking remains flexible.

Tip: If you want an even lower spend and are comfortable using public buses/metro, you could combine a standard city bus ride with pay-on-arrival entry to individual classical gardens (Humble Administrator’s Garden, Lingering Garden, etc.). Entry tickets (≈ US $6-10) are purchased locally, so they do not appear in this online tour inventory and therefore weren’t included in the “cheapest three” list above.

products.name: Admission to Sagrada Família with Audio Guide
products.shortDescription: An audio-guided tour of the famous Modernist masterpiece

data.additionalInfo:
Children aged 0–15 years must be accompanied by an adult. 

You will need to download the Sagrada Família app on your mobile device for an audio-guided visit. 

The audio guide is not available for children aged 0–10 years. 

Sign language guides are available in Catalan, Spanish and international. 

You can use the tickets only on the day, date and time specified on the ticket. 

Children can participate in the tour for free, however, you still need to reserve a ticket for them. 

At the entrance, visitors will have their bags, rucksacks, luggage and personal items checked. 

Visits must follow the route in one direction only. You'll enter on Carrer de la Marina (Nativity façade) and exit on Carrer de Sardenya (Passion façade).

Please bring your ticket with you to the attraction.

Be aware that operators may cancel for unforeseen reasons.

You need to be 18 years or older to book or be accompanied by an adult.
data.description:
This tour of Sagrada Família will offer access and an audio guide that gives insights into Gaudí’s masterpiece.

During the tour, you'll be able to admire the spiral-shaped towers, tree-like columns and stunning facade of this basilica as long as you like. From your audio guide, you'll learn about the various design styles that influenced Gaudí, the origins of the church and facts about its unique architecture.

restrictions: Children under 16 years old must be accompanied by an adult.

data.additionalInfo:
Please note that all Summit tickets are timed. Please arrive at your scheduled time, which is indicated on your ticket. 

The Summit operates at full capacity. You might not be able to get in if arriving more than 20 minutes after the time indicated on your ticket. 

Any late arrival is subject to availability and a rescheduling fee

Children aged 0–5 years can join for free.

Please note that some rooms and installations have mirrored floors. Please dress comfortably and in accordance with the tour. Trousers, shorts or tights are recommended. Sunglasses are recommended for day visits. Note that stiletto heels, steel-toe boots and any footwear that could cause damage to the mirrored floors are not allowed on this tour.

Please note that there is no storage for personal items. Large bags, large backpacks and luggage are not permitted on this tour.

Professional photographs are available to purchase in print and digital format at the end of the tour.

Food and drinks, including cocktails, are available for purchase on-site, at Après. 

WiFi access is available throughout the Summit.

Please bring your ticket with you to the attraction.

Be aware that operators may cancel for unforeseen reasons.

You need to be 18 years or older to book or be accompanied by an adult.
data.description:
With this ticket to the Summit One Vanderbilt, you’ll see futuristic digital shows inside one of New York’s newest skyscrapers. You’ll also take in views of Manhattan from a height of 370 metres. 

As you explore three levels of multi-sensory galleries inside the skyscraper, you’ll see digital art installations by internationally acclaimed artists and designers. You’ll see works inspired by stories, optical illusions and interactivity. You’ll also see the busy streets below the building during the ‘Levitation’ experience, which involves standing on a transparent platform over 300 metres above the ground. 

When you reach the SUMMIT Terrace, you can see New York’s skyline and views for up to 80 miles. You can also order cocktails and light fare from Café Après.

reviews.content: Amazing experience. Recommend this highly. The views were spectacular and the immersive experiences were wonderful.

This ticket will give you admission to the 9/11 Memorial & Museum. While there, you'll be able to explore a collection of artefacts, archives and multimedia displays related to the events of 9/11. You will also have the opportunity to see the last visible remains of the Vesey Street staircase, known as the 'Survivors' Staircase'. 

Additionally, you will be able to visit the Memorial Plaza pools, which were built where the World Trade Center once stood.

Detailed side-by-side comparison

| Feature | SUMMIT One Vanderbilt | 9/11 Memorial & Museum |
|---------|----------------------|------------------------|
| What it is | Three-level, multi-sensory observation deck 370 m up One Vanderbilt skyscraper | Museum & twin reflecting-pool memorial dedicated to the 2001 attacks |
| Location | 45 E 42nd St (next to Grand Central Terminal, Midtown) | 180 Greenwich St, World Trade Center site, Lower Manhattan |
| Core experience | Immersive mirrored rooms, “Levitation” glass sky-boxes, skyline terrace, optional cocktails at Après café | Self-guided walk through artifacts, archival footage, Survivors’ Staircase, memorial pools outside |
| Typical visit time | 1–1.5 hours inside SUMMIT (longer if you linger on the terrace) | 2–3 hours museum + time at outdoor pools |
| Views | 360° city panorama: Empire State Building, Chrysler, Central Park | Emotional/historic focus; limited elevated views but outdoor plaza looks up at new WTC skyscrapers |
| Atmosphere | Futuristic, artistic, upbeat; photo-friendly | Reflective, educational, somber |
| Representative online price* | US$46.82 (adult) | US$33 (adult) |

| Child policy | Ages 0-5 free | Ages 0-6 free |

| Not included / extras | “Ascent” exterior glass-elevator ride, food & drinks | Guided tour (audio guide available on-site) |
| Good to know | Arrive within 20 min of slot; mirrored floors require flat shoes & sunglasses recommended | Large bags (over 8″×17″×19″) not allowed; photography permitted but phone calls prohibited inside exhibits |

*Prices are the latest representative public amounts returned by the API and may fluctuate.

November 2024 ticket availability (API live-calendar)

• SUMMIT One Vanderbilt – Tickets are still AVAILABLE every day from 1 Nov to 30 Nov.  
• 9/11 Memorial & Museum – Tickets are AVAILABLE on most November days; currently UNAVAILABLE on 5 Nov, 12 Nov, 19 Nov and 28 Nov, but all other dates (1-4, 6-11, 13-18, 20-27, 29-30 Nov) have availability.

Bottom line  
If you want cutting-edge visuals and sky-high photos, choose SUMMIT. For historical reflection and a deeper understanding of 9/11, choose (or add) the Memorial & Museum. Since both still have plenty of November slots, you can comfortably fit both into a single New York itinerary—just secure timed tickets in advance, especially for the museum dates that are already showing limited inventory.

data.description:
Join a sightseeing boat tour of Miami Beach and the iconic Millionaire's homes. Explore the mesmerizing beauty of Biscayne Bay, while getting an exclusive glimpse into the luxurious lifestyle of Miami's elite, with a bilingual commentary.

Navigate through the beautiful waters and be captivated by the panoramic views of Miami's skyline, the vibrant Port of Miami, the secluded Fisher Island, and the sun-kissed shores of Miami Beach. Witness the opulent mansions of Miami Beach, a testament to the lavish lives of the rich and famous.

All Guests must check in at Bayride Ticket Kiosk located behind Victorias secret at the north end of Bayside Marketplace for a boarding pass.

data.description:
During this half-day tour, you’ll have the chance to discover some of Miami’s top sites by bus and boat.

You’ll first board a double-decker bus and zoom across the city, exploring famous spots such as Coconut Grove, Little Havana, the Financial District, downtown and Bayside Marketplace, among others. At the market, you’ll have the chance to eat, shop and relax.

Additionally, you’ll take a 90-minute boat cruise that will lead you to Millionaires’ Row, Star Island, Hibiscus Island, Palm Island, Venetian Island, Fischer Island and more.

data.description:
This admission ticket will gain you access to Gardens by the Bay, a Marina Bay waterfront attraction showcasing the best in horticulture and gardening. Here, you’ll see plants native to Singapore as well as some rarely seen in this climate or part of the world. 

In the Flower Dome – 2015 Guinness Book World Record holder for largest glass greenhouse in the world – you’ll enter an environment where it’s always spring and something is always blooming. Here, you’ll find flora from semi-arid regions and the Mediterranean. 

In Cloud Forest, you’ll encounter mountain vegetation and views and get an education on the unique plants that inhabit this type of area – and why it’s beginning to dwindle. You’ll spend quite a bit of time here as there are multiple levels and views to take in and explore. 

This tour will also include a tour of Floral Fantasy which features flora displays with four different garden landscapes. You’ll get to see hanging gardens and various floral designs along with light displays in the evening when you’re at the venue. Additionally, you can climb up the Supertree Observatory that provides scenic views of the gardens and the city skyline from one of the Supertrees.

messages.content:
Top 2 “trending” attractions in Singapore  
1. Admission to Universal Studios Singapore  
2. Admission to Gardens by the Bay  

Detailed side-by-side snapshot

General profile  
• Type of experience  
  – Universal Studios: Full-scale Hollywood-style theme park with 7 themed zones (Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, Lost World, Far Far Away, Madagascar).  
  – Gardens by the Bay: 101-hectare waterfront horticultural park featuring the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, Supertrees, Floral Fantasy and several sky-walk / observatory options.  

• Atmosphere & target audience  
  – Universal: High-energy rides, shows, meet-and-greets; best for families with older children, thrill-seekers, movie/TV fans.  
  – Gardens: Calmer, scenic and educational; suits all ages and mobility levels, nature lovers, photographers.  

Practical details  
• Current lead operator  
  – Universal: Klook (ticket fulfiller)  
  – Gardens: GlobalTix Pte Ltd (ticket fulfiller)  

• Representative online price (adult)  
  – Universal: US $63.01  
  – Gardens: US $15.16 (price may vary by combo option)  

• Free-for-children rule  
  – Both venues allow children aged 0–3 yrs to enter free (ID may be required).  

• Typical time needed  
  – Universal: 6-8 hours (a full day to clear most rides).  
  – Gardens: 2-4 hours for the two conservatories; 4-6 hours if you add Supertree Observatory, Floral Fantasy and night light-up.  

• Reviews (Booking.com Attractions stats)  
  – Universal: Avg. 4.8/5 (≈12,676 combined ratings; 79 % positive)  
  – Gardens: Avg. 4.3/5 (≈167 combined ratings; 81 % positive)  

• Cancellation/flexibility  
  – Both products currently show “No free cancellation”. Dates are fixed once booked.  

• Unique highlights  
  – Universal: World-class coasters (Battlestar Galactica, Revenge of the Mummy), 4D & live shows, seasonal parades & Halloween Horror Nights (Sept/Oct).  
  – Gardens: Guinness-record Flower Dome, 35-m Cloud Forest waterfall, evening Garden Rhapsody light show at the Supertrees, panoramic skyline views from the OCBC Skyway / Supertree Observatory.  

Ticket availability in October 2024 (latest live calendar)  
• Universal Studios Singapore – NO dates marked available for 21–31 Oct (earlier dates not listed, and all shown October dates are sold out). Conclusion: assume no October availability at this time.  
• Gardens by the Bay – Tickets ARE available 25–31 Oct (21–24 Oct sold out). Good availability from 25 Oct onward.  

Bottom line  
– Universal Studios is the pricier, high-thrill all-day outing; however, it is currently sold out across October.  
– Gardens by the Bay is far cheaper, nature-centric and still has inventory for the last week of October, making it the only one of the two where you can still secure tickets this month. Check your preferred date quickly, as the remaining October stock may disappear.

data.description:
Embark on this full-day Rio de Janeiro City Tour with a guide and visit Rio de Janeiro's top landmarks and highlights.
We visit to Corcovado Mountain and the Christ the Redeemer statue going through the Paineiras route. The 20-minute drive to the base of the statue takes you through the Tijuca Forest and gives you a preview of the landscapes ahead. The statue stands 710 meters tall and from this vantage point, you’ll have sweeping views of the city.
We also visit the Sugar Loaf. The cable car ride to the top of the mountain is done in 2 stages: begin at the boarding station to Urca Mountain (224 meters) and then from Urca Mountain to the top of Sugarloaf Mountain (395 meters).
Let’s also stop at the Metropolitan Cathedral, the Arcos da Lapa with the traditional Selarón Staircase, the Sambadrome and the Maracanã Stadium.
This tour includes tour guide, tickets to the Christ the Redeemer and the Sugarloaf, Buffet lunch and round-trip transportation.

data.description:
On this half-day tour, you’ll head to Mount Corcovado to see the Christ the Redeemer statue up close and explore highlights of Rio. The drive to the statue will take you through the vast Tijuca Forest and on arrival, you’ll have sweeping views over the city from the iconic monument, one of the Seven Wonders of the World. 

In the city, you’ll gain insight into typical architecture and the culture of Brazil as you visit several landmarks. You’ll make stops at the modern Metropolitan Cathedral with its unique, conical structure and stained glass, the Arcos da Lapa where you’ll find the artistic Selarón Steps, the Sambadrome and the Maracanã Stadium where you can take photos from the outside.

data.description:
On this small-group morning or afternoon tour, you’ll spend some time at the elaborate underground network of the Chu Chi Tunnels to learn about its lengthy history and significance to the city. You’ll watch a 3D movie about the biggest American ground operation of the Vietnam War. In the underground tunnels, you’ll gain insights into how the complex worked and how life was in the tunnels from 1961 to 1972. You’ll have the chance to try a small hidden entrance in the tunnel to understand how people used to move around in there. Throughout the maze of tunnels, there will be storage facilities, trap doors, weapons factories, command centres and field hospitals. 

You’ll get to taste a popular food during the war days called cassava. For an additional charge, you’ll have the option to fire an M16 rifle at a shooting site.

Most-trending products returned for Ho Chi Minh City (sorted by “trending”)  

1. Small-Group Tour of the Cu Chi Tunnels – ID PRB576eRp00g  
2. Ho Chi Minh City Free Walking Tour (Architecture, History & Food) – ID PRFSjlpdT6Mh  

Detailed side-by-side snapshot
-----------------------------------------------------------------
THE EXPERIENCE  
• Cu Chi Tunnels: Half-day excursion (morning or afternoon) to the famous Viet Cong tunnel network 60 km northwest of the city; includes a 3-D war film, guided walk through restored tunnels, cassava tasting, optional shooting-range activity.  
• Free Walking Tour: ±3-hour walk in the downtown core; mixes headline sights with back-alley “hidden gems” (old apartment cafés, colonial architecture) told through a local’s personal stories.  

PACE & PHYSICAL DEMAND  
• Cu Chi: Light trekking on uneven ground, climbing into tight tunnel entrances; not advised for visitors with serious heart problems.  
• Walking Tour: Urban sidewalks, fully wheelchair/stroller friendly; suitable for all fitness levels.  

WHAT’S INCLUDED  
• Cu Chi: Hotel pick-up & drop-off (city center), A/C minivan or bus, English-speaking guide, bottled water & cool towel, basic travel insurance.  
• Walking Tour: English-speaking local guide only. (Food/drink or museum fees at your own cost; experience runs on a tips basis).  

PRICE (from)  
• Cu Chi: US $17.99 per person (fixed).  
• Walking Tour: US $1.88 booking fee (covers platform costs) + voluntary tip (typical €10–30 per guest). Total cost therefore flexible, often still the cheapest paid activity in town.  

CANCELLATION POLICY  
Both offer free cancellation when booked through Booking.com/Viator.  

LANGUAGE  
Cu Chi: Guided in English (UK).  
Walking Tour: Guided in English by local host.  

ACCESSIBILITY  
Cu Chi: Public transport nearby but tunnels themselves are NOT wheelchair accessible.  
Walking Tour: Fully wheelchair & stroller accessible; all areas step-free.  

OPERATOR  
Cu Chi: KIM TRAVEL (well-established tour operator).  
Walking Tour: Detoured Asia (local community of licensed guides).  

CUSTOMER FEEDBACK  
• Cu Chi: 663 combined reviews, average 4.6 / 5 (≈98 % positive).  
• Walking Tour: 13 reviews, average 5.0 / 5 (100 % positive, small sample).  

DECEMBER AVAILABILITY (checked via live availability calendar)  
• Cu Chi Tunnels – Every date 1 Dec 2024 → 31 Dec 2024 currently shows “Available”.  
• Free Walking Tour – Every date 1 Dec 2024 → 31 Dec 2024 currently shows “Available”.  
→ Tickets/spots can be reserved today for any December day for both experiences.

Which one to pick?
• Choose Cu Chi if you want Vietnam-War history, a half-day out of town, hotel transport, and don’t mind confined spaces.  
• Choose the Free Walking Tour for an inexpensive, flexible, fully accessible introduction to the city’s culture, architecture, and café scene.  
• Short on time? Do both: Walking tour on your arrival day for orientation, Cu Chi the next morning/afternoon for deeper historical context.

Tip: December is high season; despite current availability, popular departure times (early-morning Cu Chi, late-afternoon walking tour) often fill up first—reserve once your dates are firm.

With this ticket, you’ll get admission to Mahanakhon SkyWalk, one of Thailand’s highest towers. Depending on your ticket choice, you can enjoy a 360-degree view of Bangkok from the rooftop on the 78th floor or from the King Power Mahanakhon Observatory on the 74th floor. 

As part of the experience, you can also travel by the Multimedia Elevator, explore the Digital Walls Corridor, walk across one of the world’s largest glass floors, and visit the indoor and outdoor viewing points. Additionally, you can explore the rooftop bar and dine at Thai Taste Hub restaurant.

Detailed side-by-side comparison
General theme & experience  
• Osaka Castle ‑ Iconic 16th-century fortress; eight museum floors of armour, artefacts and a rooftop panorama over Osaka.  
• teamLab Botanical Garden ‑ Night-time digital-art experience that turns the 240 000 m² Nagai Botanical Garden into an interactive, light-and-sound installation.  

Setting / ambience  
• Historical landmark, mostly indoors (+ rooftop) inside the castle keep.  
• Open-air garden, completely outdoors and best experienced after dark.  

Representative price (adult)

Popularity & guest ratings

• teamLab: Avg. 4.4/5 from 2 163 combined reviews; 444 recent written reviews.

• Both products are operated by Klook and do NOT include free cancellation.  
• Minimum booking age 18 yrs (or accompanied by an adult) for both.  
• Castle ticket admits children aged 0-16 free; teamLab has no specific free-child clause.  

Practical notes  
• Castle visit involves stairs/elevators through eight floors; give yourself 1-2 hours.  
• teamLab is entirely outdoors – dress for weather; exhibition closes in heavy rain or high winds.  
• Comfortable shoes recommended for both; gardens involve 1.5-2 km of pathways.

data.description:
This ticket will give you access to Capilano Suspension Bridge Park. While there, you'll be able to walk across the Capilano Suspension Bridge, which is 137 metres in length and is suspended 230 feet above the Capilano River. 

After seeing the bridge, you will have the chance to walk on The Cliffwalk – a glass walkway thats curves around a cliff face high above the Capilano River. You'll also get the opportunity experience the Treetops Adventure, which is home to seven suspension bridges and an evergreen forest.

Aftwerwards, you'll have the chance to enjoy the park's musical entertainment and shows, which feature elements of First Nations culture. After the performances, you'll be free to explore the Totem Park and learn about the area's history at the Story Centre. You can also pick up some souvenirs and homemade fudge at the gift shop.

data.additionalInfo:
Please note that all visitors are required to undergo a security check before entering the Arc de Triomphe.

The opening hours of the Arc de Triomphe are as follows:
- October–March: daily, 10:00–22:30
- April–September: daily, 10:00–23:00.

Please note that last admission is available 45 minutes before closing.

The Arc de Triomphe is closed on 1 January, 1 and 8 May (morning), 14 July, 11 November (morning) and 25 December.

Guide books are available in Chinese, Dutch, English, French, German, Japanese, Italian, Portuguese, Russian and Spanish.

The lift is available for visitors with limited mobility.

The attraction is accessible for wheelchair users. 

Food and drinks from outside are not allowed inside the attraction.

Children aged 0–17 years can enter for free. A valid ID is required.

Please note that free admission is available for all visitors on the third weekend of September and on the first Sunday of the month from 1 January to 31 March and from 1 November to 31 December.

Please note that the European Union nationals aged 18–25 years can enter for free. A valid photo ID is required.

Please follow the local COVID-19 guidelines and regulations in order to visit the attraction.

The ticket is valid for one year.

Please bring your ticket with you to the attraction.

Be aware that operators may cancel for unforeseen reasons.

You need to be 18 years or older to book.

age.label: Children aged 0 to 4 years can participate for free.

data.additionalInfo:
Please note that the Family Pack ticket option is valid for two adults aged 16 years and above and two children aged 5–15 years. 

Please present your pass to the City Cruises staff at Westminster Pier or Tower Pier for the river cruise. 

Please note that pets are not allowed on the bus except for guide dogs. 

Please note that the City Sampler option (1-day ticket) is only valid for the day of purchase and does not include the Thames river cruise. 

The Red route starts at 08:30 and ends at 18:00. Please note that a bus departs every 10–15 minutes. 

The Blue route starts from Marble Arch, Park Lane at 08:40 and ends at 17:00. Please note that a bus departs every 30 minutes. 

The Green route starts from Belvedere Road at 09:18 and ends at 16:50. Please note that a bus departs every 30 minutes. 

The Red route passes by the key sights and top attractions of London, including: 
- The Tower of London 
- Trafalgar Square 
- St Paul’s Cathedral 

The London Eye stops are as follows: 
- Grosvenor Gardens 
- STA Travel 
- Stop Z6: Hyde Park, Queen Elizabeth Gate, on the right of Statue of Achilles 
- Stop X: Speakers Corner near Marble Arch 
- Stop Z: London Marble Arch Station, Park Lane 

The Blue route passes by all prominent museums located in the heart of West London, such as: 
- The Victoria and Albert Museum 
- Natural History Museum 
- The Science Museum 
- Kensington Palace 
- Royal Albert Hall 
- Harrods 

The Blue route stops are as follows: 
- London Marble Arch Station Park Lane, outside Bob Forstner showroom in Knightsbridge 
- Stop 13: Royal Albert Hall 
- Stop K3: Kensington Road and Gloucester Road 
- Stop GZ: Victoria & Albert Museum, etc. 

The Green route acts as a shuttle service, picking customers up so they can connect with the Red Route at Stop 1 or Stop 2. 
The stops are as follows: 
- Stop 1: Belvedere Road, Stand 3788, behind the London Eye 
- Stop 2: Aldwych, outside One Aldwych Hotel, Southampton Row, etc.

data.description:
This bus tour offers you the chance to explore the City of London on your own pace. You can choose between a one-day ticket, a 24-hour ticket with river cruise or a 48-hour ticket with river cruise to visit the top landmarks and tourist sites in the city. You can hop on and off the bus as many times as you like, as long as your pass is valid. 

You will have access to different bus routes and can also go on a river cruise on the Thames.

data.description:
With this admission ticket, you'll have the chance to visit Hong Kong Disneyland. You'll get to meet popular characters from iconic Disney stories and movies from Pixar, Marvel and Star Wars. There are seven theme parks with plenty of amusement facilities and entertainment experiences. Additionally, you can go to its themed hotels, have a snack or buy souvenirs from the shops. 

The park tickets also allow you to join the carnival, explore the forests of various countries, visit museums, play games and experience the night parade accompanied by street performances.

reviews.content: We had 2 day ticket, but were just one day because of typhoon Jagi...But anyways it was great, better then Orlando, cause the max wait time was 20 minutes...did not see tomorrow land, but adventure and fantasy land were great !

This place is not worth the trouble. It’s a massive tourist trap. The food is a ripoff, $30 aud for a medium sized burger, drink and chips. No characters walking around greeting the kids. The only good part was Small World. Huge lineups for all the rides. In my opinion it was a big disappointment. $260 aud for 2 tickets. Never again. 😞
We had a wonderful experience in Disneyland Hong Kong!

Here is what I found for penguin-related activities that match (or do not match) your requested time windows.

   • Product: “Cape Town Private, Cape Point Penguin Tour”  
   • Earliest/Latest slots still showing availability (10000 + tickets per slot):  
     – 06:00, 09:00, 11:00, 13:00 (all GMT+2)  
   • Languages offered: English, German, French, Spanish, Italian (live guide)  
   • Price: US $163.20 per adult (same for any language)  
   • Pickup included; no free-cancellation option is offered.  
   • Reservation limits: 1-15 people; ages 16-95.  

   → None of the available slots begin after 21:00, so there is currently no penguin activity in Cape Town that meets your “after 9 PM” requirement for 13 Nov.

2. Port Elizabeth (Gqeberha) – Monday 18 November 2024  

   • Product: “Port Elizabeth Adventure: Tuk-Tuk, Penguins, & Cape Recife”  
   • Slot: Full-day ticket (listed start time 00:00, i.e., midnight; qualifies as “before 4 AM”).  
   • Availability: 10 000 + tickets left.  
   • Language: English (live guide).  
   • Price: €91.44 ≈ US $98.53 per adult.  
   • Free cancellation: 100 % refund up to 24 h before the tour.  
   • Pickup included.  
   • Reservation limits: 1-15 people; age range 5-88.

   Brief tour outline (from operator):
   – Hop aboard an open tuk-tuk for a fun ride through Port Elizabeth’s beachfront.  
   – Visit Cape Recife Nature Reserve to see the local African penguin colony.  
   – Learn about marine conservation projects, lighthouse history, and coastal ecosystems.  
   – Optional swim or walk on unspoiled beaches before returning to town.  
   – Total duration: approx. 4–5 hours (but the “full-day” slot simply means the operator chooses an early-morning departure and keeps the rest of the day flexible).

Next steps if you want to book:
• Cape Town: consider earlier daytime slots or another date; evening penguin tours do not appear to be scheduled.  
• Port Elizabeth: the 00:00 full-day slot has ample availability—reserve any number up to 15 seats.

Let me know if you’d like me to hold seats, look for different dates/locations, or find alternative penguin experiences (e.g., Boulders Beach self-entry, marine-life boat trips, etc.).
